page.title: 09 Land Use:Eastern Half
page.content: The{River Avon}flows roughly from North to South through the Eastern half of the block. It is used by fishing and canoeing clubs as well as for irrigation by local farmers. Of the flat clayey land 51% is {arable,}growing mainly wheat with some barley and potatoes. There is a developing vineyard at Tytherton Lucas. 34% of the land is{grassland for Friesan dairy cows and breeding Herefords and several are used for rearing pheasants for shooting. The remaining 15% is covered by roads, the mainline railway from the west to London, houses and gardens and small patches of woodland used as cover for foxes and pheasants. Most of the area is hunted by the Duke of Beaufort's fox hounds and the Marlborough College Beagles.
